sen.j: 円載（えんさい、生年不詳 － 元慶元年（877年））は、平安時代前期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Ensai (year of birth unknown – 877) was a priest of the Tendai sect of the early Heian period.
Ensai (year of birth unknown – 877) was a priest of the Tendaishu sect of the early Heian period.
Ensai (year of birth unknown – 877) was a priest of the Tendaishu sect of the early Heian period.
He was from Yamato Province.

sen.j: 幼い頃から日本天台宗の祖最澄に師事し、838年（承和 (日本)5年）天台座主円澄の天台宗義に関する疑問50条を携えて唐に渡った。
sen.e: From his childhood he studied under Saicho, the founder of the Nihon (Japanese) Tendai sect, and in 838 went to T'ang (China) bearing with him 50 questions on the doctrine of the Tendai sect raised by Tendai zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect), Encho.
sen.cmt: 「創価学会」のウェブサイトによれば、円澄の疑問は30だったようです。「⑤円唐決一巻。日本国三十問謹案科直答。円澄が慈覚（円仁）と円載等の入唐の時に三〇条の疑問を託し、円載が天台山に持参して広修の決答を得たもの。」http://www.japan-soka.jp/jiten.html
sen.e: From his childhood, he studied under Saicho, the founder of the Nihon (Japanese) Tendaishu sect, and in 838 went to Tang (China) bearing with him 50 questions on the doctrine of the Tendaishu sect raised by Tendai zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect), Encho.

From his childhood, he studied under Saicho, the founder of the Nihon (Japanese) Tendaishu sect, and in 838 went to Tang (China) bearing with him 50 questions on the doctrine of the Tendaishu sect raised by Tendai zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect), Encho.

sen.j: 天台山広修・維蠲（いけん）の「唐決」を得て弟子の仁好（にんこう）に託して日本に送った。
sen.e: He obtained 'Toketsu' (answers from Chinese priests to the questions raised by Saicho, Encho, and so on)from Koshu and Iken of Mt. Tendai (Tendai sect) and sent it to Japan through his disciple, Ninko.
sen.cmt: 「唐決」は「中国・唐代の道邃・広修・惟●（維●）らが比叡山の伝教・円澄などの質問に答えたもの。」とありますが、「伝教」は一段上の日本語原文にあります‘最澄’のことですので、その名前で統一しました。「広修」の読み方は「こうしゅ」で、「中国・唐代、天台宗の僧」となっています。また、「天台山」の後ろに（天台宗）を付けました。以上、いずれも上と同じサイトから。http://www.japan-soka.jp/jiten.html
sen.e: He obtained Toketsu (a collection of questions on Tendai doctrine posed by Japanese Tendai monks with answers by Chinese Tiantai masters) from Koshu and Iken of Mt. Tendai (Mt. Tiantai) and sent it to Japan through his disciple, Ninko.

He obtained Toketsu (a collection of questions on Tendai doctrine posed by Japanese Tendai monks with answers by Chinese Tiantai masters) from Koshu and Iken of Mt. Tendai (Mt. Tiantai) and sent it to Japan through his disciple, Ninko.

sen.j: その後も唐に残り学識を持って宣宗 (唐)の帰依を受け、また、855年（斉衡2年）円珍とともに長安青龍寺法全（はっぜん）から灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: Remaining in T'ang even after that, with his scholarship he accepted becoming a believer in Buddhism by Senso (T'ang Dynasty), and in 855 he received kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor) along with Enchin from Hazzen of Qinglongsi Temple of Changan.

Remaining in Tang even after that, with his scholarship he accepted becoming a believer in Buddhism by Xuanzong (Tang Dynasty), and in 855 he received kanjo (a ceremony to be the successor) along with Enchin from Hazzen of Qinglongsi Temple of Changan.
sen.cmt: 読みは原文に合わせ、半角英字にしました。

sen.j: この間、日本の朝廷から2度にわたり黄金の送金を受けていた。
sen.e: Meanwhile he had received two remittances of gold from the Japanese Imperial Court.

sen.j: 877年（元慶元年）日本へ帰る途中船が難破して横死を遂げた。
sen.e: In 877 on his way back to Japan, he died oshi (unnatural death) suffering shipwreck.
In 877 on his way back to Japan, he died an unnatural death from a shipwreck.

sen.j: なお、唐に滞在している間に破戒悪行があったとも伝えられている。
sen.e: Furthermore, there have been rumors that while he stayed in T'ang he had some destructive bad behaviors.
Furthermore, there have been rumors that while he stayed in Tang he had some destructive bad behaviors.
Furthermore, there have been rumors that while he stayed in Tang he had some destructive bad behaviors.

sen.j: なお、唐滞在中に会昌の廃仏に遭遇し、他の多くの僧と同様に強制的に還俗させられており、妻子も持った。
sen.e: Besides, while he stayed in T'ang he encountered persecution of Buddhists in the Huichang era, and as well as other priests he was forced to return to secular life and even had a wife and children.
Besides, while he stayed in Tang he encountered persecution of Buddhists in the Huichang era, and as well as other priests he was forced to return to secular life and even had a wife and children.

sen.j: これが「破戒悪行」として日本に伝わった可能性もある。
sen.e: This can be known to Japan as his 'destructive bad behavior'.

sen.e: Ennin who stayed in T'ang during the same period was also forced to return to secular life (it was just before his return to Japan that Ennin took the tonsure again.
